Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Animal Chalice or Grand Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with single band in added white; exterior, slip very worn; one broad band above a thin line preserved.
Curator's comments: The thickness of the sherd suggest that it may have come from a heavy chalice. Chalice kraters belong to the Mature Animal Style and Grand Styles. Perhaps from same chalice as 1965,0930.269.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1612) (phase 2)
